    • ADRIAN

Along your Python learning journey, someone may have told you that a great way to level up your skills is to read code written by other people. Thatâ€™s definitely true, but itâ€™s not easy to find good sources of code to read and study. Python offers some advantages here because not only is the code open source, but the discussion surrounding design decisions is public, too.

    • REAL PYTHON
    • course

Learn about Python text classification with Keras. Work your way from a bag-of-words model with logistic regression to more advanced methods leading to convolutional neural networks. See why word embeddings are useful and how you can use pretrained word embeddings. Use hyperparameter optimization to squeeze more performance out of your model.

Discussions

  • PEP 563, PEP 649, å’Œ pytantic çš„æœªæ¥
    • GITHUB.COM/SAMUELCOLVIN

Python 3.7 introduced postponed evaluation of type annotations behind the from future import annotations switch, a feature originally proposed in PEP 563. Libraries like pydantic, used extensively in the popular FastAPI framework, have found it difficult to support PEP 563, which is set to become the default in Python 3.10. A new PEP aims to alleviate some of the issues, but sentiment is mixed.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

Articles, Tutorials and Talks

  • 200 è¡Œ Python ä»£ç æ£€éªŒåŸºæœ¬éŸ³ä¹ç†è®º
    • MANOHAR VANGA

Music has always had a close relationship with mathematics and makes heavy use of repeated patterns and formulas. These characteristics make music ripe for investigation with code. This article covers some of the basics of Western music theory with examples in Python. The article is quite accessible â€” no knowledge of reading sheet music needed! After youâ€™ve read the article, check out the discussion on Hacker News.

Have you ever wondered how the barcodes you see on products work? Did you know that the first barcodes originated from Morse code? This article teaches you how UPC-A barcodes, one of the current barcode standards, work and how you can create them from scratch using Python.

import simplematch as sm

def mood_convert(smiley):
    moods = {
        ":)": "good",
        ":(": "bad",
        ":/": "sceptic",
    }
    return moods.get(smiley, "unknown")

sm.register_type("smiley", r":[\)\(\/]", mood_convert)

sm.match("I'm feeling {mood:smiley} *", "I'm feeling :) today!")
>>> {"mood": "good"}

entry.title: pythonista-weekly : Pyw 495
entry.content:
æ¬¢è¿é˜…è¯»ã€Špythonistaå‘¨åˆŠã€‹ç¬¬495æœŸã€‚Let us start!

åŸæ–‡: https://mailchi.mp/pythonweekly/python-weekly-issue-495
ç¿»è¯‘ï¼šDustyposa

æ¥è‡ªèµåŠ©å•†ï¼ˆPSï¼šåŸæ–‡çš„èµåŠ©å•†ï¼‰:

REST APIs with Flask and Python Build professional REST APIs with Python, Flask, Flask-RESTful, and Flask-SQLAlchemy

æ–°é—»

The PSF is hiring a Python Packaging Project Manager! Thanks to a two-year grant commitment from Bloomberg, our second 2021 Visionary Sponsor and a long term committed supporter of the Python ecosystem, The Python Software Foundation (PSF) is hiring a full-time project and community manager for the Python Packaging ecosystem, with a specific focus on the Python Package Index (PyPI).

Unifying the CUDA Python Ecosystem åˆ°ç›®å‰ä¸ºæ­¢ï¼Œé€šè¿‡ Python è®¿é—® CUDA å’Œ NVIDIA GPU åªèƒ½é€šè¿‡ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹è½¯ä»¶æ¥å®ç°ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ Numbaã€CuPyã€Scikit-CUDAã€RAPIDSã€PyCUDAã€PyTorch æˆ– TensorFlow ç­‰ç­‰ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªäººéƒ½åœ¨ CUDA API å’Œ Python ä¹‹é—´å†™äº†è‡ªå·±çš„äº’æ“ä½œå±‚ã€‚é€šè¿‡å‘å¸ƒ CUDA Pythonï¼Œè‹±ä¼Ÿè¾¾è®©è¿™äº›å¹³å°æä¾›å•†èƒ½å¤Ÿä¸“æ³¨äºè‡ªå·±çš„å¢å€¼äº§å“å’ŒæœåŠ¡ã€‚è‹±ä¼Ÿè¾¾è¿˜å¸Œæœ›é™ä½å…¶ä»– Python å¼€å‘è€…ä½¿ç”¨è‹±ä¼Ÿè¾¾ GPU çš„å‡†å…¥é—¨æ§›ã€‚

æ–‡ç« ã€æ•™ç¨‹ä¸è¯é¢˜

ä¸€ä¸ªäººç§‘æŠ€åˆ›ä¸šå…¬å¸èƒŒåçš„æ¶æ„ éå¸¸æ£’çš„ä¸€ç¯‡æ–‡ç« ï¼Œä»è´Ÿè½½å‡è¡¡åˆ€ä»»åŠ¡ç›‘æ§åŠè®¢é˜…ï¼Œå®Œå…¨å‰–æäº† SaaS çš„èƒŒåã€‚

How I built a â‚¬25K Machine Learning Rig å¦‚ä½•è§„åˆ’ã€è´­ä¹°ã€æ„å»ºå’Œå­˜å‚¨ä½ çš„2-10å° GPU æœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ æœåŠ¡å™¨å’Œ PCã€‚

Porting VaccinateCA to Django æœ€åˆï¼ŒVaccinateCA æ˜¯ç”±ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡å®šåˆ¶çš„ Airtable å®ä¾‹é©±åŠ¨çš„ï¼Œä¼´éšç€ä¸€ä¸ªå®šåˆ¶çš„ JavaScript åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºçš„è°ƒç”¨è€…ï¼Œé€šè¿‡ä¸€äº› Netlify å‡½æ•°ä¸ Airtable API é€šä¿¡ã€‚äº†è§£å®ƒæ˜¯å¦‚ä½•è¢«ç§»æ¤åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„è‡ªå®šä¹‰ Django åç«¯ï¼Œè¿è¡Œåœ¨ PostgreSQL ä¹‹ä¸Šã€‚

å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨FastAPIæŠ½è±¡æ¥æŸ¥è¯¢AWSæ•°æ®æ¹– æ•°æ®æ¹–æä¾›äº†æ— æ•°çš„å¥½å¤„ã€‚å®ƒä»¬æ˜¯ä¸å¯çŸ¥çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦ä½ é¢„å…ˆå®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªæ¨¡å¼ã€‚ç„¶è€Œï¼Œå¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªåˆé€‚çš„ç»“æ„ï¼Œè¦æ‰¾åˆ°ä½ éœ€è¦çš„æ•°æ®å¯èƒ½ä¼šå¾ˆå›°éš¾ã€‚åœ¨æœ¬æ–‡ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°†é€šè¿‡åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ª FastAPI æŠ½è±¡æ¥è§£å†³è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼Œä½¿æˆ‘ä»¬èƒ½å¤ŸæŸ¥è¯¢ AWS Glue å…ƒæ•°æ®ç›®å½•ã€‚

Pythonçš„dataclasseså°†ä¸ºä½ èŠ‚çœæ—¶é—´ï¼Œè¿˜å…·æœ‰attrsçš„ç‰¹ç‚¹ åœ¨è¿™ä¸ªè§†é¢‘ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬äº†è§£äº†æ•°æ®ç±»ä»¥åŠå¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨å®ƒä»¬ï¼Œä»¥åŠæ•°æ®ç±»æ‰€åŸºäºçš„ç›¸å…³ attrs åº“ã€‚

Python Typing with mypy å¤§å‹ä»£ç åº“ä¸Šçš„æ¸è¿›å¼ç±»å‹æ£€æŸ¥ã€‚

Python 3 Types in the Wild: A Tale of Two Type Systems æœ¬æ–‡æ¢è®¨äº†å¼€å‘è€…å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨è¿™äº›ç±»å‹æ³¨é‡Šï¼Œç±»å‹æ£€æŸ¥å’Œæ¨ç†å·¥å…·æä¾›çš„ç±»å‹ç³»ç»Ÿè¯­ä¹‰ï¼Œä»¥åŠè¿™äº›å·¥å…·çš„æ€§èƒ½ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬åœ¨ GitHub å…¬å…±ä»“åº“çš„è¯­æ–™åº“ä¸Šè¯„ä¼°äº†è¿™äº›ç±»å‹å’Œå·¥å…·ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬å›é¡¾äº† MyPy å’Œ PyType è¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªå…¸å‹çš„é™æ€ç±»å‹æ£€æŸ¥å’Œæ¨ç†å·¥å…·ï¼Œä»¥åŠå®ƒä»¬ä¸åŒçš„ç±»å‹åˆ†ææ–¹æ³•ã€‚ç„¶åï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬è®¨è®ºäº†ä¸‰ä¸ªç ”ç©¶é—®é¢˜ã€‚(i) å¼€å‘è€…ä½¿ç”¨ Python 3 ç±»å‹çš„é¢‘ç‡å’Œæ–¹å¼æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿ(ii) å¼€å‘è€…ä¼šçŠ¯å“ªäº›ç±»å‹é”™è¯¯ï¼Ÿ(ä¸‰) ä¸åŒå·¥å…·çš„ç±»å‹é”™è¯¯å¦‚ä½•æ¯”è¾ƒï¼Ÿ

Integrating Rust into Python è¿™ç¯‡æ–‡ç« è¯¦ç»†ä»‹ç»äº†å°† Rust ä¸ Python é›†æˆçš„å…·ä½“æœºåˆ¶ï¼Œä»¥æé«˜æ€§èƒ½ï¼Œè€Œä¸”ä¸è´¹å¹ç°ä¹‹åŠ›ã€‚

Using PyTorch + NumPy? You're making a mistake. ä¸€ä¸ªå›°æ‰°ç€æˆåƒä¸Šä¸‡çš„å¼€æº ML é¡¹ç›®çš„ bugã€‚

æ·±åº¦å­¦ä¹ æ¨¡å‹å‹ç¼© è¿™ç¯‡æ–‡ç« æ¶µç›–äº†ä»2021å¹´3æœˆå¼€å§‹åœ¨å¹¿åº¦å’Œæ·±åº¦ä¸Šçš„æ¨¡å‹æ¨ç†ä¼˜åŒ–æˆ–å‹ç¼©ã€‚è¿™åŒ…æ‹¬åƒæ¨¡å‹é‡åŒ–å’ŒäºŒå€¼åŒ–è¿™æ ·çš„å·¥ç¨‹ä¸»é¢˜ï¼ŒåƒçŸ¥è¯†æç‚¼è¿™æ ·çš„æ›´é¢å‘ç ”ç©¶çš„ä¸»é¢˜ï¼Œä»¥åŠä¼—æ‰€å‘¨çŸ¥çš„å°æŠ€å·§ã€‚

Python 3.9.4 hotfix is now available Python 3.9.3 was released two days ago on Friday, April 2nd. It contains important security content listed below for reference. Unfortunately, it also introduced an unintentional ABI incompatibility, making some C extensions built with Python 3.9.0 - 3.9.2 crash with Python 3.9.3 on 32-bit systems. To minimize disruption, I decided to recall 3.9.3 and introduce this hotfix release: 3.9.4.

Django 3.2 This version has been designated as a long-term support (LTS) release, which means that security and data loss fixes will be applied for at least the next three years. It will also receive fixes for crashing bugs, major functionality bugs in newly-introduced features, and regressions from older versions of Django for the next eight months until December 2021.

Django security releases issued: 3.1.8, 3.0.14, and 2.2.20

Python 3.10.0a7https://matplotlib.org/3.4.0/users/whats_new.html)

Virtual: Graph QL - The What, The Why, The How Ever wondered what all the hype around GraphQL is about? Is it the estranged sibling of SQL? What is its obsession with graphs anyway? This talk will walk through the what, the why and the how of GraphQL. By the end of this presentation we will have a working GraphQL server in Python that you can build and deploy at home!
